Access.description: Liste des consentements accordés à l'AISP par le PSU.

post.summary: Initiates of a Payment Request on a PSU account on behalf of a merchant
post.description: Initiates of a Payment Request on a PSU account on behalf of a merchant

403.description: Forbidden, authentication successful but access to resource is not allowed.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be passed as a header

parameters.name: PSU-IP-Address
parameters.description: IP address used by the PSU's terminal when connecting to the TPP

parameters.name: PSU-IP-Port
parameters.description: IP port used by the PSU's terminal when connecting to the TPP

parameters.name: PSU-HTTP-Method
parameters.description: Http method for the most relevant PSU's terminal request to the TTP

parameters.name: PSU-Date
parameters.description: Timestamp of the most relevant PSU's terminal request to the TTP

parameters.name: PSU-GEO-Location
parameters.description: Geographical location of the PSU as provided by the PSU mobile terminal if any to the TPP

parameters.name: PSU-User-Agent
parameters.description: "User-Agent" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

parameters.name: PSU-Referer
parameters.description: "Referer" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP.Notice that an initial typo in RFC 1945 specifies that “referer” (incorrect spelling) is to be used. The correct spelling “referrer” can be used but might not be understood.

parameters.name: PSU-Accept
parameters.description: "Accept" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

parameters.name: PSU-Accept-Charset
parameters.description: "Accept-Charset" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

parameters.name: PSU-Accept-Encoding
parameters.description: "Accept-Encoding" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

parameters.name: PSU-Accept-Language
parameters.description: "Accept-Language" header field sent by the PSU terminal when connecting to the TPP

parameters.name: PSU-Device-ID
parameters.description: UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) for a device, which is used by the PSU, if available

parameters.name: x-forwarded-host
parameters.description: The x-forwarded-host header is used to indicate the original host requested by the client, as seen by a proxy or load balance

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description: http-signature of the request (cf. https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-cavage-http-signatures/)The keyId part of the header should be formatted as follows keiId="SN=XXX,CA=YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY" where "XXX" is the serial number, in hexadecimal without any prefix (like 0x), of the QSEAL certificate whose relevant private key was used for signing "YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY" is the the Issuer DN, full Distinguished Name of the Certification Authority having issued this certificateHTTP400 will be returned by the server in case of invalid or absent signature

parameters.name: X-Request-ID
parameters.description: Correlation header to be set in a request and retrieved in the relevant response

get.description: Returns transactions for an account for a given PSU account that is specified by the AISP through an account resource identification. The request may use some filter parameter in order to restrict the query on a given imputation date range or past a given incremental technical identification. The result may be subject to pagination.

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: Inclusive minimal imputation date of the transactions.

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: Exclusive maximal imputation date of the transactions.

parameters.name: afterEntryReference
parameters.description: Specifies the value on which the result has to be computed.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token to be passed as a header

get.summary: Récupère la liste des bénéficiaires de confiance (AISP)
get.description: Récupère la liste des bénéficiaires de confiance pour le PSU.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Access token à passer en header

post.summary: Vérifie la disponibilité des fonds sur le compte PSU

200.description: Demande de couverture de paiement acceptée

info.description: L’API DSP2 a pour objectif de servir et contrôler les demandes provenant des Tiers externes.
info.title: DSP2

tags.name: PaymentRequests
tags.description: Endpoint that allows a TPP to initiate a payment

tags.name: Accounts_DSP2
tags.description: Cette ressource permet de restituer la liste des comptes du PSU autorisés pour un TPP de type AISP.

tags.name: Consents
tags.description: Cette ressource permet de recevoir les informations sur les droits accordés aux comptes du PSU pour le TPP

tags.name: FundsConfirmations
tags.description: The PISP can ask an ASPSP to check if a given amount can be covered by the liquidity that is available on a PSU cash account or payment card. The ASPSP answers with a structure embedding the original request and the result as a boolean.

tags.name: TrustedBeneficiaries
tags.description: Endpoint permettant de récupérer la liste des bénéficiaires de confiance (AISP)

tags.name: EndUserIdentity
tags.description: Retrieval of the identity of the end-user (AISP)
